doc.field: Communist Party of the United States of America Records
Communist Party of the United States of America Records

The varied purposes of the CPUSA's commissions highlight many of the social issues central to Party work throughout the 20th centuryâ€”racial and gender equality, cultural engagement, youth rights, and economic freedom. Correspondence, discussion documents, and reports found in this subseries detail policy development and internal dialogue. Many commissions which focus on Party work with ethnic communities are represented in this subseries, as is the Agitprop Commission which directed early Party endeavors to mobilize workers. Also found here are the records of the Video Department which provide a glimpse of efforts to publicize the Party via television and other newer forms of media. The largest set of files are from the Economics Commission, long headed by Victor Perlo. There are also files from the Black Liberation, Chicano Liberation and Cultural Commissions.
Communist Party of the United States of America Records
